item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 7: ICICI Prudential, Bajaj Finserv, Manappuram Finance, Ashoka Buildcon and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 7: ICICI Prudential, Bajaj Finserv, Manappuram Finance, Ashoka Buildcon and more

Date: January 7, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights significant stock movements and announcements from various companies as of January 7, 2025.

  • ICICI Prudential: Received a GST demand order upheld by the Commissioner on January 6.
  • Caplin Point: FDA inspection concluded with zero observations at Gummidipoondi facility.
  • Bajaj Finserv: Gross direct premium for December reaches ₹1,330.9 crore.
  • Manappuram Finance: Incident of daylight robbery reported with a loss of ₹20 crore.
  • Ashoka Buildcon: Secured a ₹1,391 crore project for a new economic corridor in West Bengal.
  • NESCO: Declared highest bidder for wayside amenities along the Bengaluru-Chennai Expressway.
  • SH Kelkar: Reported 17% YoY revenue growth with plans for double-digit growth.
  • Nuvoco Vistas: Selected bidder for Vadraj Cement’s assets in the corporate insolvency resolution process.
  • Akzo Nobel: Proposed strategic evaluation for powder coatings business.
  • Power Grid: Won two significant projects under the TBCB process for transmission upgrades.
  • Bharti Airtel: Sells 50% stake in Firefly Networks for ₹45 million.
  • Coal India: Partnered with IREL for critical mineral development.
  • Vodafone Idea: Sold 50% stake in Firefly Networks for ₹4.5 crore.
  • IndiGo: Imposed a ₹2.17 crore penalty from customs authority.
  • ICICI Securities: Settled a Sebi case by paying ₹40.2 lakh.

item.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Up Amid Trump Tariff Hopes; Nvidia, Chip Stocks Gain On This (Live Coverage) - Investor's Business Daily
item.description:
Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Up As Trump Says This On Tariffs; Nvidia Pops As 3 Stocks Clear Entries (Live Coverage)

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Investors.com

The stock market saw positive momentum with the Dow Jones Industrial Average gaining nearly 400 points influenced by President Trump's remarks on tariffs and strong performance from tech stocks, particularly Nvidia.

  • The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose nearly 400 points, or 0.9%.
  • Nvidia surged by nearly 5%, clearing the 146.54 buy point of a double-bottom base.
  • FuboTV's stock price more than doubled after announcing a deal with Walt Disney.
  • Chip stocks rallied following Foxconn's impressive Q4 revenue report.
  • The Nasdaq composite rose about 2%, pulling further above its 21-day exponential moving average.
  • Trump denied reports of a reduced tariff policy, labeling them as 'Fake News.'
"The story in the Washington Post... incorrectly states that my tariff policy will be pared back. That is wrong." - Donald Trump

This day marked a significant rally in the stock market, particularly in the tech sector, indicating a bullish trend as multiple stocks break clear buy points.

item.title: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm - DNA India
item.description:
Mukesh Ambani's Reliance enters new market with Rs 10 product, big challenge to Tata firm

Publication Date: January 6, 2025

Source: DNA India

Mukesh Ambani continues to expand his business empire with the introduction of a new rehydrating beverage, RasKik Gluco Energy, priced at just Rs 10 per single-serve drink. This move follows Reliance's recent acquisition of Campa Cola and positions the company to compete directly with Tata Consumer Products in the beverage market.

  • Reliance's market cap stands at Rs 16.48 lakh crore.
  • The RasKik Gluco Energy beverage aims to redefine rehydration in India.
  • Products currently offered include mango, apple, mixed fruit, coconut water, and nimbu pani.
  • Reliance aims to expand its portfolio inspired by regional fruit varieties.
"RasKik is now uniquely positioned to provide a variety of accessible and great quality fruit-based drinks." - Reliance Consumer Products Ltd

This product launch exemplifies Reliance's commitment to merging traditional Indian consumer heritage with modern product offerings, highlighting the company's ambition to become a leader in the beverage sector.

item.title: Gold dips lower while Trump pushes back on rumors around universal tariff imposing scheme - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Dips Lower While Trump Pushes Back on Rumors Around Universal Tariff Imposing Scheme

Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: FXStreet

Markets are reacting to President-elect Trump's comments on potential tariffs, causing gold prices to dip.

  • Trump pushes back on rumors about universal tariffs.
  • Gold prices drop to around $2,633 after a week of gains.
  • Technical analysis indicates gold is in a pennant formation, anticipating a breakout.
  • Geopolitical tensions are rising as global leaders interact with the Trump administration.
  • Market is preparing for a busy economic calendar including US Nonfarm Payrolls.
“Tariffs are set to be instated in their original form,” – President-elect Trump.

This situation highlights the volatility in the market and the influence of political announcements on commodity prices.

item.title: PM Modi meets Microsoft's Satya Nadella, discusses tech, innovation and AI - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi meets Microsoft's Satya Nadella, discusses tech, innovation and AI

Publication Date: January 06, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday met Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, discussing technology, innovation, and AI.

  • Discussions focused on Microsoft's expansion plans in India.
  • Nadella expressed commitment to making India AI-first.
  • PM Modi hailed the ongoing digital transformation in India.
“Thank you, PM @narendramodi ji for your leadership. Excited to build on our commitment to making India AI-first...” - Satya Nadella

In conclusion, the meeting underscores the collaborative spirit between the Indian government and Microsoft, aiming to drive digital transformation and technological growth in India.

item.title: Gold prices dip as yields rise, market girds for US economic data - Reuters
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment - Decrypt
item.description:
Bitcoin Tops $100,000 for First Time in 2025 as Trump Trade Continues to Spur Sentiment

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: Decrypt

Bitcoin has surpassed the $100,000 mark for the first time this year, buoyed by positive trader sentiment and developments in the market.

  • Bitcoin reached a price of $101,192, though it has not yet returned to its all-time high of $108,135.
  • The cryptocurrency traded below $100,000 for a nearly three-week period before this increase.
  • Factors such as the Federal Reserve's interest rate projections affected market sentiment, but optimism remains high.
  • President-elect Trump's intention to establish a U.S. strategic Bitcoin reserve is influencing investor behavior.
  • Bitcoin is seen as navigating a tactical trading range, presenting unique strategic opportunities.
“Rather than a continuous rally, Bitcoin appears to be navigating a tactical trading range...” - 10x Research

The recent surge in Bitcoin's price reflects both market resilience and strategic positioning as investors adapt to changing economic conditions.

item.title: Sensex to cross 1 lakh soon? Target 2025: 'Expect India to be...' - Morgan Stanley's BULL vs BEAR stock market case - ET Now
item.description:
Morgan Stanley Predicts Sensex Could Reach 1 Lakh by 2025

Updated: January 6, 2025 | Source: ET Now

The year 2025 may bring significant gains for stock market investors, according to Morgan Stanley, which outlines a bullish and bearish position for the BSE Sensex's future performance.

  • Morgan Stanley projects a 14% rise in Sensex by December 2025, potentially reaching 93,000.
  • The brokerage favors cyclicals over defensives and small/mid-caps over large-caps.
  • Bull case target for Sensex is set at 105,000, while the bear case target is 70,000.
  • Global growth risks and near-term growth concerns are challenges, but India remains a top pick in emerging markets.
“Most risks to our views come from outside India,” Morgan Stanley noted.

In conclusion, Morgan Stanley's insights highlight a positive outlook for India's stock market in 2025, encouraging investors to pay attention to market dynamics and strategic stock picks.

item.title: Higher Returns For Investors Aged 80+, SBI Launches Special FD For Super Senior Citizens, Know Details - News18
item.description:
SBI Launches Special FD Scheme for Super Senior Citizens Aged 80+

Date: January 06, 2025
Source: News18

The State Bank of India has introduced the 'SBI Patrons' scheme catering specifically to Super Senior Citizens aged 80 and above, offering higher interest rates on term deposits.

  • The new scheme, 'SBI Patrons', is geared toward both new and existing customers.
  • Super Senior Citizens are defined as individuals aged 80 years or older.
  • Interest rates for this scheme are set at 10 basis points higher than standard senior citizen rates.
  • The scheme is aimed at recognizing the patronage of Super Senior Citizens with added financial benefits.
  • Minimum deposit starts at Rs 1,000, with an upper limit less than Rs 3 crores.
  • Deposits can be made for a period ranging from 7 days up to 10 years.
  • The scheme includes options for premature withdrawal with applicable penalties.
“SBI has a market share of about 23% in deposits.”

This initiative is part of SBI’s commitment to support senior citizens, enabling them to achieve better returns on their savings.

item.title: Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment - News18
item.description:
Infosys Postpones Salary Hikes; Know IT Company's Plan On Pay Increment

Date: January 06, 2025
Source: Moneycontrol

India’s second-largest IT services company, Infosys, has decided to postpone its annual salary hikes until the fourth quarter of FY25 due to ongoing global market challenges.

  • Salary increments, typically implemented earlier in the year, will now be staggered; some will take effect in January 2025, with others in April 2025.
  • Other major IT firms have also deferred pay raises as a response to weakened client budgets and macroeconomic pressures.
  • Infosys reported a 2.2% sequential net profit increase, reaching Rs 6,506 crore, despite missing market expectations.
  • The company's margins improved slightly, supported by better operational efficiencies and lower onsite costs.
  • Selective increments are still being offered to high-performing employees in specialized fields like AI.
“In today’s uncertain economic environment, holding on to a job itself is being viewed by many as a significant advantage.”

Despite the delay in pay hikes, some analysts believe that Infosys' margin pressures may ease thanks to strategic cost-management initiatives.

item.title: I am rich, have no idea what to do…: Indian-origin founder after selling $975 million company - The Economic Times

item.title: Live Updates CES 2025: Nvidia, Samsung, Sony, Toyota reveals, plus more - TechCrunch
item.description:
Live Updates CES 2025: Nvidia, Samsung, Sony, Toyota reveals, plus more

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: TechCrunch

This article covers key highlights from CES 2025, focusing on major reveals from companies like LG, Nvidia, Samsung, Sony, and Toyota.

  • LG showcased their AI-integrated smart home solutions via their AI agent, LG FURON.
  • William Cho, CEO, emphasized holistic experiences through AI in living spaces.
  • Strategic partnership with Microsoft announced, enhancing home, mobility, and commercial offerings.
  • Expanded cloud gaming experience for Xbox was highlighted.
“At LG, we’re seamlessly integrating AI into physical living spaces around us.” - William Cho

The advancements and collaborations presented at CES 2025 showcase a growing trend towards integrating cutting-edge technology into everyday life, emphasizing user comfort and interaction.

item.title: Titagarh Rail delivers India's first driverless 'Make-in-India' trainset to Bengaluru Metro - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Titagarh Rail delivers India's first driverless 'Make-in-India' trainset to Bengaluru Metro

Published: 06 January 2025, 14:11 IST

Kolkata: Titagarh Rail Systems Ltd has achieved a significant milestone by handing over its first driverless, Made-in-India trainset to Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation's Yellow Line, marking a critical advancement in India's urban mobility journey.

  • The trainset was produced at Titagarh Rail's metro manufacturing facility in Uttarpara, West Bengal.
  • It features a stainless steel body and is designed for high performance on the 18-km stretch from Electronics City.
  • Union Minister Manohar Lal commended the achievement, stating that India aims to surpass the U.S. in metro rail operations in the next five years.
  • The Automated train includes advanced automation allowing it to operate in driverless mode.
  • Titagarh will additionally supply two more trainsets for the Yellow Line by April and plans to ramp up production.
"As we inaugurate Bengaluru Metro’s new trainset and surpass 1,000 kilometres of operational metro rail, we celebrate a significant milestone in India’s urban mobility journey..." - Manohar Lal

This delivery highlights India's progress in rail manufacturing and aligns with the Prime Minister’s vision of a developed India.

item.title: Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said - ET Now
item.description:
Namma Metro Yellow Line Bangalore: RV Road to Bommasandra section opening on January 6? What BMRCL said

Updated: January 5, 2025 09:20 IST

Bengaluru's Yellow Line, connecting RV Road to Bommasandra, has generated excitement but the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has denied January 6, 2025, launch rumors. The first train will be unveiled on that date, with subsequent deliveries scheduled.

  • The Yellow Line will span 18.82 kilometers with 18 stations.
  • MP Tejasvi Surya confirmed the delivery schedule of trains.
  • The initial operations will feature three trains, expanding by August 2025.
“I am equally frustrated with the repeated delays in the start of the Yellow Line.” – Tejasvi Surya

The Yellow Line is anticipated to enhance connectivity in Bengaluru, especially aiding commuters to the Electronics City tech hub.

item.title: Multibagger stock: 25,200% returns in 5 years! Promoter raises stake in small-cap stock under ₹100. Do you own? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Multibagger stock: 25,200% returns in 5 years! Promoter raises stake in small-cap stock under ₹100. Do you own?

Date: January 6, 2024 Source: Mint

Electric Vehicle manufacturer Mercury EV-Tech Limited's promoter group has increased its stake significantly through a preferential allotment process.

The key highlights of the article are as follows:

  • Promoter Raghuvir International Pvt Ltd acquired over 14.75 lakh equity shares and 53 lakh share warrants.
  • The promoter's stake increased from 22.92% to 24.74% after the acquisition.
  • The company's shares closed at ₹91.33, down 4.99% from the previous close.
  • Mercury EV-Tech has delivered nearly 25,200% returns over the last five years.
“Allotment of new equity shares which will rank pari passu with the existing equity shares.”

In conclusion, the stock's significant returns and recent stake acquisition demonstrate confidence in Mercury EV-Tech's future growth potential.

item.title: SEBI relaxes norms for settling client accounts inactive for 30 days - The Economic Times
item.description:
SEBI Eases Rules for Settling Inactive Client Accounts

Publication Date: January 6, 2023

Source: Economic Times

Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has relaxed norms regarding the settlement of accounts by brokerages for clients who have not traded in over 30 days. This aims to improve efficiency and facilitate business.

  • The revised rules allow settlements for clients who trade again after 30 days and before the next monthly settlement cycle.
  • This change comes following concerns raised by the Brokers’ Industry Standards Forum regarding procedural inefficiencies.
  • Settlements are now to be aligned with the annual calendar of settlements notified by exchanges.
  • The new provisions take effect immediately.
"It has been decided to revise the requirement of mandatory settlement of such clients’ funds." - SEBI circular

This regulatory change is expected to streamline processes and enhance the ease of doing business for brokerages while safeguarding investor interests.

item.title: Nirma Group's Nuvoco Vistas Corp to acquire Vadraj Cement via NCLT route - Business Standard
item.description:
Nirma Group's Nuvoco Vistas Corp to Acquire Vadraj Cement via NCLT Route

Publication Date: Monday

Source: Nirma Group Announcement

Nuvoco Vistas Corp, a company promoted by the Nirma Group, has emerged as the successful applicant for Vadraj Cement in a corporate insolvency resolution process (CIRP).

  • The transaction will increase Nuvoco's cement capacity from 25 MTPA to approximately 31 MTPA, a 20% increase.
  • The resolution plan submitted by Nuvoco has been approved by the committee of creditors.
  • Nuvoco plans a phased investment over 15 months for refurbishment of assets and operational improvements.
  • Production is expected to commence around Q3 of FY27, pending approvals.
  • Vadraj Cement is currently undergoing insolvency with admitted claims of Rs 8,180.61 crore.
“Overall investment, including refurbishment of assets, will be more cost-effective than greenfield or brownfield expansions.”

This acquisition reinforces Nuvoco's position as the fifth largest cement manufacturer in India.

item.title: European shares, euro surge after report of more targeted US tariffs - Reuters

item.title: Amit Banerji, co-founder of workspace operator Table Space, dies of heart attack at 44 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amit Banerji, Co-Founder of Table Space, Dies of Heart Attack at 44

Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Amit Banerji, 44, passed away from a heart attack, according to a company statement. He co-founded Table Space in 2017 and served as its CEO, contributing significantly to the managed workspace sector.

  • Co-founded Table Space in 2017 with Karan Chopra.
  • Previously worked for Accenture for over 13 years.
  • Company aimed for a valuation of $2.5 billion in its planned IPO for 2025.
  • Recognized for his expertise in real estate and business management.
"It is with deep sadness that we announce the passing of Mr. Amit Banerji, our Founder, Chairman, and CEO... his impact on the company and the industry will be lasting."

Banerji's death adds to the recent losses of notable startup figures, highlighting a tragic trend within the entrepreneurial community.

item.title: Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 13.32x as NIIs led bid; Check GMP, subscription data | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates

Date: 6 Jan, 2025 Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The Standard Glass Lining IPO launches today with a price band of ₹133-140 per share, aiming to raise ₹410.05 crore. The issue was subscribed 13.32x on the first day as NIIs led the bidding.

  • The IPO opened for subscription on January 6 and will close on January 8.
  • It secured ₹123 crore from anchor investors ahead of the launch.
  • Reviews indicate substantial interest, with shares trading at a ₹97 premium in the grey market.
  • The issue consists of a fresh issuance and an offer for sale of shares by promoters.
  • Proceeds will be allocated for debt repayment and investment in a subsidiary.
The NII portion led the bidding round at 25.43x, followed by retail investors at 14.46x.

In summary, the Standard Glass Lining IPO is generating significant interest, reflecting a positive market outlook.

item.title: Table Space founder Amit Banerji passes away at 44 - The Economic Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Elon Musk declares ‘I am Adrian Dittmann’ after suspending reporter from X for exposing… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Elon Musk Declares ‘I am Adrian Dittmann’ After Suspending Reporter from X

Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A conspiracy theory suggesting that Elon Musk uses a fake account to promote himself took a strange twist when journalist Jacqueline Sweet was banned from X after revealing that Adrian Dittmann is a real person living in Fiji.

  • The controversy began when Jacqueline Sweet's report identified Adrian Dittmann as a German businessman.
  • Following the publication, Musk cryptically stated, “I am Adrian Dittmann. It's time the world knew.”
  • Sweet's account was suspended for 30 days after mentioning Dittmann, which was subsequently flagged as containing “violent or misleading content.”
  • Supporters of Musk celebrated Sweet's suspension, arguing that she breached ethical boundaries by exposing personal details about Dittmann.
  • Critics of Musk claim the suspension stifled journalistic freedom and attacked press rights.
This is a direct assault on press freedom.

The Twitter-like platform’s actions have raised alarms about the suppression of journalism in favor of maintaining Musk's public image.

item.title: Reliance Consumer Products enters rehydration market with ₹10 energy drink - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Reliance Consumer Products Launches ₹10 Rehydration Drink 'RasKik Gluco Energy'

Date: January 6, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Reliance Consumer Products Ltd (RCPL) has launched RasKik Gluco Energy, a new rehydration drink priced at just ₹10. This marks RCPL's strategic entry into the rehydration category, aiming to meet the hydration and energy needs of consumers.

  • The drink combines electrolytes, glucose, and real lemon juice.
  • RasKik aims to offer consumer-focused products for everyday hydration.
  • It will include various flavors and will expand its portfolio based on Indian regional tastes.
  • Ketan Mody, COO, emphasizes the brand's connection to Indian traditions.
“RasKik Gluco Energy is not just a drink, it is more than just hydration – it’s about revitalising and energising the Indian consumer to take on the challenges of the day,” said Ketan Mody.

RasKik Gluco Energy will be available soon in a 750 ml home consumption pack.

item.title: Stocks to buy: M&M to Policy Bazaar - MOFSL recommends three shares for this week | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stocks to buy: M&M to Policy Bazaar - MOFSL recommends three shares for this week

Date: January 6, 2023 Source: Live Mint

On January 6, the Indian stock market saw a significant decline, largely influenced by concerns over a new virus outbreak in China. The Nifty 50 and Sensex indices fell substantially, leading to a broad-based sell-off.

Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd has recommended three stocks for investors to consider buying this week, citing their potential for significant growth.

  • Mahindra & Mahindra: Buy at ₹3190, Target Price: ₹3400
  • Kalyan Jewellers: Buy at ₹777, Target Price: ₹850
  • Policy Bazaar: Buy at ₹2215, Target Price: ₹2400
“We expect markets to remain volatile until concerns relating to the new virus ease out.” - Siddhartha Khemka, MOFSL

The analysts emphasize the necessity for caution when investing due to rapid changes in market conditions.

item.title: ITI Ltd, Easy Trip Planners among 10 stocks that defied today’s market sell-off - The Economic Times
item.description:
Stocks Defying Market Sell-Off: ITI Ltd and Easy Trip Planners Shine

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Economic Times

India’s benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, fell over 1.6% on Monday; however, certain stocks, including ITI Ltd and Easy Trip Planners, managed to deliver notable gains.

  • ITI Ltd surged 20%, reaching an intraday high of Rs 548.50.
  • PTC Industries rose by 7.6%.
  • Other notable performers included Sunflag Iron And Steel, JTL Industries, and Aegis Logistics, each up nearly 5%.
  • Easy Trip Planners saw an increase of 3.7%.
  • Healthcare stocks gained traction due to a reported HMPV outbreak in China and confirmed cases in India.
  • Titan Company climbed 2.3% after reporting significant growth in business.
  • ICICI Bank closed 0.1% higher, providing support to the Nifty 50 index.
“Recommendations, suggestions, views, and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times.”

This market activity highlights a mix of resilience amid broader declines, particularly in specific sectors such as telecommunications and healthcare.

item.title: Zomato, Swiggy Get Buy As Anand Rathi Initiates Coverage, Sets Target Price - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Anand Rathi Initiates Coverage with 'Buy' Rating for Zomato and Swiggy

Publication Date: December 4, 2024 Source: NDTV Profit

Anand Rathi Share and Stock Brokers Ltd. has initiated coverage on food delivery aggregators Zomato Ltd. and Swiggy Ltd. with a 'buy' rating, setting target prices of Rs 385 and Rs 705 respectively.

  • Anand Rathi forecasts Zomato's revenue to reach Rs 19,299 crore in fiscal 2025 and Rs 41,131 crore by fiscal 2027.
  • Swiggy’s revenue is estimated to increase from Rs 15,052 crore in fiscal 2025 to Rs 27,259 crore in fiscal 2027.
  • The food delivery market is characterized by an entrenched duopoly which complicates entry for new competitors.
  • Zomato's strategy focuses on acquisitions, while Swiggy opts for organic growth.
  • Quick commerce, an emerging segment, is expected to grow at a 60-80% CAGR by 2028.
“We expect Zomato to continue to lead in FD (food delivery).” - Anand Rathi

The report emphasizes that both Zomato and Swiggy are well-positioned to adapt to consumer trends favoring speed and price in delivery services.

item.title: RBL Bank stock gains 2.5% following healthy December quarter business update | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
RBL Bank Stock Gains 2.5% Following Healthy December Quarter Business Update

Date: January 6, 2024 Source: Live Mint

Shares of RBL Bank ended higher at ₹166.80 apiece, marking a 2.46% gain as investors reacted positively to the bank's December quarter business update released over the weekend.

  • The stock has risen for the third consecutive day, gaining 5.6% in January 2024.
  • RBL Bank reported a 15% year-on-year increase in deposits, reaching ₹92,746 crore for Q3FY25.
  • Retail advances grew 20% YoY, and wholesale advances increased 5% YoY for the quarter ended December 31, 2024.
  • Current bucket collection efficiency for microfinance advances was 98.4% in December 2024.
  • Deposits below ₹3 crore made up approximately 50.3% of total deposits as of December 31, 2024.
“The bank continues to focus on growing the share of granular retail deposits in its overall deposit mix.”

Despite previous challenges, including a drop in standalone net profit by 24% YoY in Q2FY25, the current updates reflect a healthier financial position for the bank.
